slides.title: Introduction to General Science
slides.content:
**Science for Anganwadi Workers**

Basic science knowledge helps you:
- Understand health and hygiene
- Explain nutrition concepts
- Promote scientific practices

**Topics Covered:**
- Biology - Human body, diseases
- Physics - Basic concepts
- Chemistry - Food and water
- Environmental Science

slides.title: Human Body Systems
slides.content:
**Major Body Systems**

**Digestive System:**
- Mouth → Esophagus → Stomach → Small Intestine → Large Intestine
- Breaks down food for absorption

**Respiratory System:**
- Nose → Trachea → Lungs
- Oxygen in, Carbon dioxide out

**Circulatory System:**
- Heart pumps blood through body
- Blood carries oxygen and nutrients

**Nervous System:**
- Brain controls all body functions
- Nerves carry messages

**Skeletal System:**
- 206 bones in adult human body
- Provides structure and protection

slides.title: Nutrition Basics
slides.content:
**Essential Nutrients**

**Carbohydrates:**
- Energy source
- Found in rice, wheat, bread

**Proteins:**
- Body building
- Found in pulses, eggs, meat, milk

**Fats:**
- Energy storage
- Found in oil, ghee, nuts

**Vitamins:**
- Vitamin A - Eyes (carrot, milk)
- Vitamin B - Energy (cereals, eggs)
- Vitamin C - Immunity (citrus fruits)
- Vitamin D - Bones (sunlight, milk)
- Vitamin K - Blood clotting (green vegetables)

**Minerals:**
- Iron - Blood (spinach, meat)
- Calcium - Bones (milk, yogurt)
- Iodine - Thyroid (iodized salt)

slides.title: Common Diseases - Part 1
slides.content:
**Communicable Diseases (Spread from person to person)**

**Tuberculosis (TB):**
- Affects lungs
- Symptoms: Cough for 2+ weeks, fever, weight loss
- Spread through air
- Preventable with BCG vaccine

**Malaria:**
- Spread by mosquitoes
- Symptoms: High fever with chills
- Prevention: Mosquito nets, clean water

**Typhoid:**
- Spread through contaminated food/water
- Symptoms: High fever, stomach pain
- Prevention: Clean water, vaccination

**Measles:**
- Viral disease
- Symptoms: Fever, rash
- Preventable with vaccine

slides.title: Common Diseases - Part 2
slides.content:
**Non-Communicable Diseases**

**Diabetes:**
- High blood sugar
- Types: Type 1 (childhood), Type 2 (lifestyle)
- Control: Diet, exercise, medicine

**Hypertension (High BP):**
- Silent killer
- Control: Less salt, exercise, medicine

**Anemia:**
- Low hemoglobin/iron in blood
- Symptoms: Weakness, tiredness, pale skin
- Prevention: Iron-rich foods (spinach, meat, jaggery)

**Deficiency Diseases:**
- Goiter: Iodine deficiency (use iodized salt)
- Rickets: Vitamin D deficiency (sunlight, milk)
- Scurvy: Vitamin C deficiency (citrus fruits)
- Night blindness: Vitamin A deficiency (carrots, milk)

slides.title: Health and Hygiene
slides.content:
**Personal Hygiene Practices**

**Hand Washing:**
- Before eating and cooking
- After using toilet
- After touching animals
- Use soap and clean water

**Oral Hygiene:**
- Brush teeth twice daily
- Use fluoride toothpaste
- Avoid excess sweets

**Food Hygiene:**
- Wash fruits and vegetables
- Cook food properly
- Cover food to protect from flies
- Drink boiled or filtered water

**Sanitation:**
- Use toilets, not open defecation
- Keep surroundings clean
- Proper waste disposal
- Swachh Bharat Abhiyan

slides.title: Water and Environmental Health
slides.content:
**Safe Drinking Water**

**Water-borne Diseases:**
- Cholera
- Typhoid
- Diarrhea
- Hepatitis A

**Water Purification Methods:**
- Boiling (most effective)
- Filtration
- Chlorination
- UV treatment

**Environmental Health:**
- Air pollution: Respiratory diseases
- Water pollution: Water-borne diseases
- Soil pollution: Food contamination

**Waste Management:**
- Segregate waste: Wet and Dry
- Composting of biodegradable waste
- Avoid plastic bags
- Proper disposal of medical waste

slides.title: Basic Physics Concepts
slides.content:
**Everyday Physics**

**Force and Motion:**
- Force causes motion
- Friction opposes motion
- Gravity pulls objects downward

**Simple Machines:**
- Lever: See-saw, scissors
- Pulley: Drawing water from well
- Wheel: Transport

**Heat and Temperature:**
- Heat flows from hot to cold
- Measured in Celsius (°C)
- Normal body temperature: 37°C (98.6°F)

**Light:**
- Travels in straight lines
- Reflection: Seeing in mirror
- White light has 7 colors (VIBGYOR)

**Sound:**
- Produced by vibrations
- Travels through medium
- Cannot travel in vacuum

slides.title: First Aid Basics
slides.content:
**Emergency First Aid**

**For Cuts and Wounds:**
1. Clean with water
2. Apply antiseptic
3. Cover with clean bandage
4. Seek medical help if deep

**For Burns:**
1. Pour cold water immediately
2. Do not apply oil or toothpaste
3. Cover with clean cloth
4. Get medical help

**For Choking:**
1. Pat back firmly
2. Heimlich maneuver if trained
3. Get medical help

**For Fever:**
1. Sponge with normal water
2. Give plenty of fluids
3. Check temperature regularly
4. Consult doctor if fever persists

**For Diarrhea:**
1. Give ORS (Oral Rehydration Solution)
2. Continue breastfeeding (infants)
3. Maintain hygiene

question.questionText: Which vitamin is known as 'Sunshine Vitamin'?
question.explanation: Vitamin D is called the 'Sunshine Vitamin' because our body produces it when exposed to sunlight. It is essential for bone health and calcium absorption.
